history.content:
Hi all,

RISELab at Berkeley is a lab focusing on providing systems for data science and machine learning (e.g. distributed computing and model serving). On October 11th and October 12th, RISELab will hold its annual RISE Camp at International House.

We need undergraduate students to participate in the tutorial dry-run this Wednesday and Thursday. It's a fantastic opportunity to learn about projects in RISELab and interact with the people who built them. If you are interested in getting into research at RISE, this is a great opportunity as well. 

Please sign up for a slot here
Note: 
0. Meals will be provided. 
1. There are two sheets - one for Wednesday and one for Thursday.
2. The 1.5 hours slot will consist of a 30 minute talk and 1 hour tutorial. For the tutorial, you will work inside a hosted Jupyter lab environment (so you just need to bring your computer!). Please make sure to stay for the talk and try out the tutorial, as well as give us your feedback. 
3. The only pre-req you need is to know some python. 
Feel free to reach out to me (xmo@berkeley.edu) or rise-admin@cs.berkeley.edu for any questions!
Thanks,
Simon Mo & the RISE Team
history.subject: [Research Opportunity] RISE Camp Call for Dry-Run Volunteers

history.content:
Hi all,

RISELab at Berkeley is a lab focuses on providing systems for data science and machine learning (e.g. distributed computing and model serving). On October 11th and October 12th, RISELab will hold its annual RISE Camp at International House.

We need undergraduate students to participate the tutorial dry-run this Wednesday and Thursday. It's a fantastic opportunity to learn about projects in RISELab and interact with people who build it. If you are interested in getting into research at RISE, this is a great opportunity as well. 

Please sign up for a slot here
Note: 
0. Meals will be provided. 
1. There are two sheets you can toggle between Wednesday and Thursday slots.
2. These 1.5 hours slot will consist of 30 minutes talk and 1 hour tutorial. For the tutorial, you will work inside a hosted Jupyter lab environment (so you just need to bring your computer!). Please at least stay for the talk and try to play with tutorial and give feedback. 
3. Only pre-req is know some python. 
Feel free to reach out to me (xmo@berkeley.edu) or rise-admin@cs.berkeley.edu for any questions!
Thanks,
Simon Mo
